com.snowplowanalytics.snowplow.tracker.emitter

Class InMemoryEventStore

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.snowplowanalytics.snowplow.tracker.emitter.InMemoryEventStore
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EventStore

    public class InMemoryEventStore
extends java.lang.Object
implements EventStore
    Buffers events (as TrackerPayloads) in memory for sending via the BatchEmitter. The TrackerPayloads are stored in a queue. When the BatchEmitter calls getEventsBatch(int), the chosen number of TrackerPayloads are removed from the queue. The batch is added to a map of payloads that are currently being sent, and wrapped as a BatchPayload. This BatchPayload wrapper is returned to the Emitter. If the POST request is successful, the payloads are deleted from the map. If not, they are removed from the map and reinserted into the queue to be sent again.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      InMemoryEventStore()
      Make a new InMemoryEventStore with default queue capacity (Integer.MAX_VALUE).

    • Method Detail

      • addEvent

        public boolean addEvent(TrackerPayload trackerPayload)
        Add TrackerPayload to buffer. Returns false if the buffer was full. Note that the event is lost in this case.
        Specified by:
        addEvent in interface EventStore
        Parameters:
        trackerPayload - the payload to add
        Returns:
        success or not

      • getEventsBatch

        public BatchPayload getEventsBatch(int numberToGet)
        Remove some TrackerPayloads from the buffer. They are wrapped as a BatchPayload to return, and also stored in a separate collection inside InMemoryEventStore until the result of their POST request is known.
        Specified by:
        getEventsBatch in interface EventStore
        Parameters:
        numberToGet - how many payloads to get
        Returns:
        a BatchPayload wrapper, or null

      • cleanupAfterSendingAttempt

        public void cleanupAfterSendingAttempt(boolean needRetry,
                                       long batchId)
        Finish processing events after a request has been made. If the request was successful, the events are deleted from the InMemoryEventStore. If not, they are reinserted at the beginning of the buffer queue for another attempt.
        Specified by:
        cleanupAfterSendingAttempt in interface EventStore
        Parameters:
        needRetry - if true, move events back to the buffer instead of deleting
        batchId - the ID of the batch of events

      • getAllEvents

        public java.util.List<TrackerPayload> getAllEvents()
        Get a copy of all the TrackerPayloads in the buffer. This does not include any events currently being sent by the BatchEmitter.
        Specified by:
        getAllEvents in interface EventStore
        Returns:
        List of all the stored events

      • size

        public int size()
        Get the current size of the buffer. This does not include any events currently being sent by the BatchEmitter.
        Specified by:
        size in interface EventStore
        Returns:
        number of events currently in the buffer
